Title: Chiasmus
References: ŠTULAJTEROVÁ, A., JESENSKÁ, P.: English Stylistics. 1. vyd. Banská Bystrica : Univerzita Mateja Bela, 2013. 114 s.
Content:
Chiasmus is a rhetorical device in which two or more clauses are balanced against each other by the reversal of their structures.

It is also called a reversed parallel construction. It has a palindromic order of words or phrases (AB:BA). The used words are often opposite in meaning. This device helps to lay stress on the second part of the sentence, due to the sudden change of the structure.

examples:

  • It is strange - but true, for truth is always strange.
  • Never let a Fool Kiss You, or a Kiss Fool You.
